channel.title: CVE Feed for Insteon -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Insteon -- all products

item.title: CVE-2017-16337|2024-09-16T18:55:33.214Z -- insteon -- insteon%20hub%202245-222
item.description: On Insteon Hub 2245-222 devices with firmware version 1012, specially crafted commands sent through the PubNub service can cause a stack-based buffer overflow overwriting arbitrary data. An attacker should send an authenticated HTTP request to trigger this vulnerability. At 0x9d01ef24 the value for the s_offset key is copied using strcpy to the buffer at $sp+0x2b0. This buffer is 32 bytes large, sending anything longer will cause a buffer overflow.
